byline.contributor: Noah Smith reported from Santa Ana, Calif., and Ravi Somaiya from New York.
byline.original: By NOAH SMITH and RAVI SOMAIYA

abstract: California judge approves sale of Freedom Communications, parent company of newspapers The Orange Country Register and The Press-Enterprise of Riverside, to Digital First Media for about $52 million; Freedom had pushed for sale to Digital because it is running out of operating capital and feared Justice Dept monopoly objection would delay original auction bid made by Tribune Publishing.
lead_paragraph: A higher bid by Tribune Publishing for the California newspaper had been blocked by a court order at the request of the Justice Department.

headline.main: Judge Approves Orange County Register Sale to Digital First
headline.print_headline: Digital First Wins Orange County Register

snippet: A higher bid by Tribune Publishing for the California newspaper had been blocked by a court order at the request of the Justice Department.
